object.name: Rightside Down -- Blank Moving Wood Platform
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A moving platform from Rightside Down Galaxy. It has a blank surface.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Rightside Down -- Checkered Moving Wood Platform
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A moving platform from Rightside Down Galaxy. It has a checker patterned surface.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Rightside Down -- Intro Planet
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The decorative building blocks planet that can be seen at the beginning of Rightside Down Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Air Bubble
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A bubble that restores the player's air when collected underwater.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A stationary bubble that replenishes air when collected underwater. Can be collected by the Orange Luma in SMG2.

object.name: Air Bubble Generator
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A nozzle that periodically generates air bubbles.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A nozzle that periodically generates several air bubbles that replenish the player's air when underwater.

field.name: Delay
field.notes: Time between bubble spawns in frames.

field.name: Duration
field.notes: Life duration of a single bubble in frames.

object.name: Clockwork Ruins -- Luma Cage
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The red metal cage from Clockwork Ruins Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- Stationary object that will disappear once its SW_B gets triggered. Plays the "Open" animation and destroys itself after that. Plays a short cutscene using a special camera.

object.name: Cosmic Cove -- 2D Underwater Planet
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The large planet found in the 2D underwater section from Cosmic Cove Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Cosmic Cove -- 2D Sea Mine Planet
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The large planet found in Cosmic Cove Galaxy's 2D section that features Jammyfish and Sea Mines.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Cosmic Cove -- Moving Gate
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A moving metal gate from Cosmic Cove Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Collision Push Movement Area [Sphere]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- Moves compatible objects if they are on AreaMove collision triangles.
-- CLASS NOTES -- Moves compatible objects inside this area if they are bound to a floor triangle with the collision type AreaMove. Compatible objects are the player itself, BombBird and its bombs, Kuribo, Karon and CocoNut.

field.name: Speed
field.notes: Sets the movement speed.

object.name: Arrow Sign
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A large arrow-shaped sign with a red outline.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A generic map object with a model and optional collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

object.name: Arrow Switch
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An arrow-shaped switch that rotates once it gets triggered.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A rotating switch object that can be activated using Spin Attacks.

field.name: Rotation Direction
field.notes: Specifies the rotation when hit.
field.values: -1 = 180° to right or left, 0 = 90° to left, 1 = 90° to right, 2 = 180° to left, 3 = 180° to right

field.name: Activation Mode
field.notes: If enabled, it cannot be hit again util the SW_A event deactivates again.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: Sets the shadow drop length.

object.name: Multi-Use Arrow Switch
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An arrow-shaped switch that rotates once it gets triggered. Can be triggered multiple times.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Multi-Use Arrow Switch Target
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A target that triggers a switch based off of the state of the ArrowSwitchMulti that it belongs to.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: "AssemblyBlock" [Unused]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A Space Junk block that retrieves a proper model using ShapeModelNo. However, no more models exist for this object.
-- CLASS NOTES -- Remains at a resting position that can be defined by linking a GeneralPos with the name 合体ブロック故郷点 to it. Once the player gets in its range, it will move to its actual position. This class supports ShapeModelNo models. The timed activation requires additional effect data under the UniqueName "Blur".

field.name: Activation Range
field.notes: Specifies the activation range to the player's position. If set to -1, the model's diameter is used instead.

field.name: Activation Time
field.notes: If Obj_arg7 is set, this specifies the timer until the block disappears again.

field.name: Is Timed?
field.notes: If enabled, the block will be activated for a set amount of time only.

-- CLASS NOTES -- Decorative objects that are meant to be placed in the background of a galaxy, such as asteroids.

object.name: Small Decorative Asteroids
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A group of many small asteroids that serve as decoration.
-- CLASS NOTES -- Decorative objects that are meant to be placed in the background of a galaxy, such as asteroids.

object.name: Toy Time -- Yellow Rotating Platform
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A yellow rotating platform used on the 8-Bit Mario planet in Toy Time Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- An object that will rotate along it's axis.
It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

object.name: Comet Observatory Star Countdown
object.notes:

object.name: Comet Observatory -- Beacon Ring
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The red-purple ring found around the Beacon in the Comet Observatory.

object.name: Comet Observatory -- Decorative Gears

object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The interior of a Dome.

object.name: Bowser Attack Rock [Fight]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A yellow orb that appears during the boss fights against Bowser.
-- CLASS NOTES -- Usually not visible but they get activated by Bowser's attacks. Once it appears, it falls down onto ground. Then, it becomes a yellow orb that can be smashed into Bowser. Depending on the encounter number, it can also emit shockwaves.

field.name: Bowser Encounter Number
field.notes: If greater than 1, the rock will emit a purple quake wave once it lands.

object.name: Bowser Attack Rock [Final Fight]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A yellow orb that appears during the final boss fight against Bowser.
-- CLASS NOTES -- These are usually not visible until Bowser activates them during the final fight. These fly to their actual position and will remain there. The orb can be smashed into Bowser.

field.name: First Appearance Delay
field.notes: Delay until the rock appears for the first time.

object.name: Bowser Attack Rock [Stage]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A yellow orb that appears before the fights against Bowser.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A rock that emits from the ground and breaks into a yellow orb. It can be smashed into KoopaSeals.

object.name: Audio Effect Area
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- Enables a different audio effect once entered.
-- CLASS NOTES -- Sets the audio effect once entered by the player. For example, this can enable echoes.

field.name: Effect Type
field.notes: Specifies which effect configuration to use.
field.values: 0 = Default, 1 = Underground Echo, 2 = Unused, 3 = Unused, 4 = Fleet Glide, 5 = Fleet Glide, 6 = Unused

field.name: Priority
field.notes: Priority of the audio effect (unrelated to areas).

object.name: Audio Effect Area [Cube]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- Enables a different audio effect once entered. The cube's origin is the base's center.
-- CLASS NOTES -- Sets the audio effect once entered by the player. For example, this can enable echoes.

field.name: Effect Type
field.notes: Specifies which effect configuration to use.
field.values: 0 = Default, 1 = Underground Echo, 2 = Unused, 3 = Unused, 4 = Fleet Glide, 5 = Fleet Glide, 6 = Unused

field.name: Priority
field.notes: Priority of the audio effect (unrelated to areas).

object.name: Audio Effect Area [Cylinder]
object.notes:

-- CLASS NOTES -- Sets the audio effect once entered by the player. For example, this can enable echoes.

field.name: Effect Type
field.notes: Specifies which effect configuration to use.
field.values: 0 = Default, 1 = Underground Echo, 2 = Unused, 3 = Unused, 4 = Fleet Glide, 5 = Fleet Glide, 6 = Unused

field.name: Priority
field.notes: Priority of the audio effect (unrelated to areas).

object.name: Audio Effect Area [Sphere]
object.notes:

field.notes: Specifies which effect configuration to use.
field.values: 0 = Default, 1 = Underground Echo, 2 = Unused, 3 = Unused, 4 = Fleet Glide, 5 = Fleet Glide, 6 = Unused

field.name: Priority
field.notes: Priority of the audio effect (unrelated to areas).

object.name: Freezeflame Sky
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The sky model from Freezeflame Galaxy that features auroras.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Starship Mario -- Rosalina's Comet
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The large egg-shaped Comet that appears during Starship Mario's ending cutscene.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A variant of SimpleMapObj. This is a generic map object with a model, collision and a maximum far clipping distance. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

object.name: Mattermouth
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A gluttonous skull enemy from Haunty Halls Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A skull that moves around freely or on a set path. It "eats" away parts of objects that are compatible with ClipDrawArea. This enemy cannot be defeated in any way. Can be frozen by the Orange Luma in SMG2.

object.name: Haunty Halls -- Small Rotating Carpet Platform
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES --
-- CLASS NOTES -- Your typical RotateMoveObjParts, but with additional support for Clipping

object.name: Lava Lair -- Mattermouth Carpet
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The large carpet from Bowser's Lava Lair that is eaten away by Mattermouths.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Ball Beamer
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A yellow enemy with a metal nut on its head that periodically emits spherical rings of electricity.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Porcupuffer
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A purple blowfish enemy from Drip Drop Galaxy and Cosmic Cove Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A blowfish enemy that inflates once the player gets in its range. It will then home onto the player and explode after a certain amount of time. Can be frozen by the Orange Luma in SMG2.

object.name: Blimp Fruit
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The blue fruit that Yoshi can eat to expand and fly like a balloon.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A fruit that, when eaten, transforms Yoshi into Blimp Yoshi. Can be targeted by the Orange Luma to make it swing. Can be temporarily destroyed using Koopa Shells or Ground Pounds.

object.name: Generic Star Ball Opener
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A metal hole with a blue edge that is used to crack Star Balls in Rolling Green Galaxy and Rolling Gizmo Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- If the player touches this object's center while riding a Star Ball, it will pull the Star Ball towards its center and the Star Ball will be cracked open.

object.name: Rolling Coaster -- Star Ball Opener
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The round planet from Rolling Coaster Galaxy that features a hole to crack open the Star Ball.
-- CLASS NOTES -- If the player touches this object's center while riding a Star Ball, it will pull the Star Ball towards its center and the Star Ball will be cracked open.

object.name: Rolling Masterpiece -- Star Ball Opener
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A pink pencil platform from Rolling Masterpiece Galaxy that features a hole to crack open the Star Ball.
-- CLASS NOTES -- If the player touches this object's center while riding a Star Ball, it will pull the Star Ball towards its center and the Star Ball will be cracked open.

object.name: Star Ball Rail
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An invisible path that the Star Ball will move on once touched.
-- CLASS NOTES -- An invisible rail for the Star Ball. The Star Ball will automatically start to move along the path once it touches the path's beginning.

field.name: Acceleration
field.notes: Acceleration value multiplied by 1000. Default is 1500.

field.name: Deceleration
field.notes: Deceleration value multiplied by 1000. Default is 995.

object.name: Banekiti
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A mechanical spring enemy that bounces off Boo Mario upon contact. It is used in Boo's Boneyard Galaxy.

object.name: Galaxy Generator -- Rotating Stone Lift
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A rotating cylinder from Bowser's Galaxy Generator that has some small platforms attached to it. Used in the section that features Cloud Flowers and Bullet Bills.
-- CLASS NOTES -- An object that will rotate along it's axis.
It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

object.name: Space Storm Foggy Atmosphere
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The gray foggy air that surrounds the cylindrical planets in Space Storm Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- Decorative atmosphere that is meant to be placed around a planet or section.

field.name: Range
field.notes: Active distance from player's position.

field.name: Hide during Intro?
field.notes: The air won't appear during the intro if enabled.

field.name: Always Active?
field.notes: Always active if enabled.

object.name: Swooper
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A bat enemy that is mostly found in cave sections.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A flying bat enemy. These enemies may be flying around passively, move on a path or hang from ceilings. If the player comes within its range, it will fly towards them to attack. The icy variant (BasaBasaIce) will freeze the player if touched, provided that they are not using the Ice power-up. It can be defeated using Spin Attacks, Stomping and most other attacks. It can be stunned by shooting Star Bits at them. The icy variant (BasaBasaIce) can be attacked if the player is not using the Ice power-up. Can be targeted by the Orange Luma in SMG2.

field.name: Detection Range
field.notes: Range in which it will detect the player. Default is 2000.

field.name: Attacking Range
field.notes: Range in which it will attack the player. Default is Detection Range + 1000.

object.name: Ice Swooper
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An icy Swooper that can freeze the player upon contact. Can be defeated using the Ice power-up or the Invincibility power-up.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A flying bat enemy. These enemies may be flying around passively, move on a path or hang from ceilings. If the player comes within its range, it will fly towards them to attack. The icy variant (BasaBasaIce) will freeze the player if touched, provided that they are not using the Ice power-up. It can be defeated using Spin Attacks, Stomping and most other attacks. It can be stunned by shooting Star Bits at them. The icy variant (BasaBasaIce) can be attacked if the player is not using the Ice power-up. Can be targeted by the Orange Luma in SMG2.

field.name: Detection Range
field.notes: Range in which it will detect the player. Default is 2000.

field.name: Attacking Range
field.notes: Range in which it will attack the player. Default is Detection Range + 1000.

object.name: "BathtubPlanet" [Unfinished]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A bowl-shaped planet with checkered textures and hot water in the center that burns the player upon contact.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Whomp
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A large rectangular stone block enemy that can attack by falling onto the player.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A stone block enemy that moves on a fixed path. Once it sees the player, it will move towards them to fall down on them. Once it lies on the ground, the weak point on its back can be Ground Pounded. Can be frozen by the Orange Luma. It will spawn 7 Star Bits if defeated.

field.name: Movement Speed
field.notes: Defines the movement speed, multiplied by 1000. Default is 600.

field.name: Attacking Range
field.notes: The range in which it will fall down onto the ground after detecting the player.

field.name: Spawn no Star Bits?
field.notes: If enabled, it won't spawn any Star Bits after being defeated.

object.name: Whomp King
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The large stone block boss from Throwback Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A large stone block boss. He can summon Whimps that will try to attack the player like Whomps do. The boss himself can defeat those smaller blocks by crushing them. Like his smaller counterparts, this boss will try to fall onto the player to attack them. He can also attack using shockwaves that appear when he jumps. When he's lying on ground, the player can Ground Pound the weak spot on its back to damage him. After hitting the boss three times, he will be defeated. He always spawns a Power Star. He uses two GeneralPos. バッタンキング基準位置 is used as his position after the battle. マリオ位置 is used to position the player after the battle. Several messages are also required. BattanKing000 specifies the introduction text. BattanKing001 specifies the text after defeating him. Lastly, the actual cutscenes have to be specified as well: バッタンキング登場 for the opening and バッタンキングダウン for the outro.

field.name: Camera Register Starting Index
field.notes: Specifies the starting index of the camera vector register. Occupies two cameras.

field.name: Texture Frame

field.name: Shadow Length

object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- Allows the Bee power-up to fly a longer distance than usual if the player is inside this area.
-- CLASS NOTES -- If the player is using the Bee power-up and is inside this area, it will make them fly a longer distance than usual.

object.name: Faster Bee Flight Area [Cube]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- Allows the Bee power-up to fly a longer distance than usual if the player is inside this area. The cube's origin is the base's center.
-- CLASS NOTES -- If the player is using the Bee power-up and is inside this area, it will make them fly a longer distance than usual.

object.name: Topmini
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A small yellow robot enemy that is always spinning.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A small robot enemy that will make the player spin around if touched. However, it can be defeated using Spin Attacks. If it falls into water, it will be defeated as well. It can be defeated by the Orange Luma in SMG2.

field.name: Enable Returning
field.notes: If SW_A is valid and deactivated, it will always move towards its initial position.

object.name: Topmini Spawner
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A black hole that spawns Topmini. Defeated Topmini will respawn after some time.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A black hole that periodically spawns more Topman enemies. It will only generate one enemy at a time but it will ensure that the provided number of enemies will be spawned. Defeated enemies will respawn after a while. BegomanLauncher generates Spring Topmen, BegomanBabyLauncher generates Topmini and TogeBegomanLauncher generates Spike Topmen.

field.name: Activation Delay
field.notes: The delay until the first spawn occurs.

field.name: Number of Topman
field.notes: Defines the number of Topman to be spawned. Default is 1.

object.name: Spring Topman Spawner
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A black hole that spawns Spring Topman. Defeated Spring Topman will respawn after some time.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A black hole that periodically spawns more Topman enemies. It will only generate one enemy at a time but it will ensure that the provided number of enemies will be spawned. Defeated enemies will respawn after a while. BegomanLauncher generates Spring Topmen, BegomanBabyLauncher generates Topmini and TogeBegomanLauncher generates Spike Topmen.

field.name: Activation Delay
field.notes: The delay until the first spawn occurs.

field.name: Number of Topman
field.notes: Defines the number of Topman to be spawned. Default is 1.

object.name: "BegomanRoomPlanet" [Unfinished]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An unfinished planet with checkered textures. It ressembles JumpBeamerRoomPlanet.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Spiky Topman
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A red spiky robot enemy that is always spinning.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A rotating robot enemy that will make the player spin around if touched. If the player touches its spiky head, they will take damage. It can be defeated by smashing it against electric currents (such as ElectricRail). If it falls into water, it will be defeated as well.

field.name: Enable Returning
field.notes: If SW_A is valid and deactivated, it will always move towards its initial position.

object.name: Spring Topman
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A yellow robot enemy whose head can be bounced off.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A rotating robot enemy that features a spring head which the player can bounce off. It can be defeated by smashing it against electric currents (such as ElectricRail). If it falls into water, it will be defeated as well. It gets stunned when using a Spin Attack. This fully expands its spring head. If the object is called BegomanSpringHide, it will remain in the ground until the player gets in its range. This variant will also spawn a Topmini if hit with a Spin Attack. There can only be one Topmini at a time.

field.name: Enable Returning
field.notes: If SW_A is valid and deactivated, it will always move towards its initial position.

object.name: Passive Spring Topman
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A variant of a Spring Topman that resides in the ground and jumps out once the player gets near. It emits a Topmini if hit with a Spin Attack.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A rotating robot enemy that features a spring head which the player can bounce off. It can be defeated by smashing it against electric currents (such as ElectricRail). If it falls into water, it will be defeated as well. It gets stunned when using a Spin Attack. This fully expands its spring head. If the object is called BegomanSpringHide, it will remain in the ground until the player gets in its range. This variant will also spawn a Topmini if hit with a Spin Attack. There can only be one Topmini at a time.

field.name: Enable Returning
field.notes: If SW_A is valid and deactivated, it will always move towards its initial position.

object.name: Gobblegut
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The dragon boss from Bowser Jr.'s Fiery Flottila.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A long dragon boss. It features six weak spots that have to be popped using the player's attacks. It always spawns a Power Star. It uses a GeneralPos with the name プレイヤーデモ位置（ベリードラゴン戦） to position the player during the intro. If it's part of a cutscene, it also creates cutscene objects for KoopaJr and KoopaJrPod. See BellyDragonLv1Zone for a better look inside the cutscene.

See BellyDragonLv1Zone for a better look inside the cutscene.

object.name: Music Change Area
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- Changes the stage's background music in various different ways if entered.
-- CLASS NOTES -- Changes the background music using the stage's music information in StageBgmInfo. Supports several different changing modes.

field.name: Change Type
field.notes: The music change type.
field.values: 0 = Change Song, 1 = Fade-out and Change Song, 2 = Change State

field.name: Argument 1
field.notes: ChangeBgmName index into StageBgmInfo if Obj_arg0 is set to 0. ChangeBgmState index into StageBgmInfo if Obj_arg0 is set to 2. Fade time if Obj_arg0 is set to 1.

field.name: Argument 2
field.notes: ChangeBgmName index into StageBgmInfo if Obj_arg0 is set to 1. Fade time if Obj_arg0 is set to 2.

field.name: Comet Music Type
field.notes: Sets how music changes are handled during Comet missions.
field.values: -1 = Music change is ignored during Comet, 1 = Music change is enforced during Comet

object.name: BgmProhibitArea
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES --
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Music Volume Area
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- Changes the background music's volume if entered.
-- CLASS NOTES -- When the player enters this area, the music's volume will be changed. The volume resets if the player leaves the area again.

field.name: Fade Time
field.notes: The music's fade time in frames. Default is 90.

field.name: Volume
field.notes: The music's volume multiplied by 100.

object.name: Big Amp
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An electric ball-shaped enemy that moves on a set path.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A large electric ball enemy that causes electrical damage. It can only be defeated using the Invincibility power-up. They will move on a path or in a circular motion if no path was assigned. When it attacks something, for example the player, it will pause for a short amount of time.

field.name: Movement Speed
field.notes: Sets the movement speed.

field.name: Shadow Type
field.notes: Sets the shadow type.
field.values: -1 = Validate shadows, 1 = Invalidate shadows

field.name: Texture Frame

field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

object.name: Amp
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A small electrical enemy that moves on a path or in a circular motion.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A small electric ball enemy that causes electrical damage. It can only be defeated using the Invincibility power-up. They will move on a path or in a circular motion if no path was assigned. When it attacks something, for example the player, it will pause for a short amount of time.

field.name: Movement Speed
field.notes: Sets the movement speed.

field.name: Side Type
field.notes: Specifies the side direction.
field.values: -1 = Side is path direction, 1 = Opposite of path direction

field.name: Shadow Type
field.notes: Sets the shadow type.
field.values: -1 = Validate shadows, 1 = Invalidate shadows

field.name: Gravity Type
field.notes: Specifies the gravity calculation type.
field.values: -1 = Ignore gravity, 0 = Negated gravity is up. Always calculate gravity, 1 = Negated gravity is up. Calculate gravity once

object.name: Toy Time -- Cake Planet
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The cake planet used in the third mission of Toy Time Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Black Hole [Spherical Attraction]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A Black Hole that sucks in the player or defeats some enemies in its range. This one has a spherical attraction range.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A black hole that sucks in the player and some compatible objects if they enter its range. This will kill them immediately. BlackHole objects use a spherical range whereas BlackHoleCube objects use a box-shaped range. The object's scale settings are used to specify the affection area whereas the size of the model can be changed using Obj_arg0.

field.name: Model Scale
field.notes: Scales the black hole model. Does not change the object's affection area. Default is 1000.

object.name: Black Hole [Cubic Attraction]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A Black Hole that sucks in the player or defeats some enemies in its range. This one has a box-shaped attraction range.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A black hole that sucks in the player and some compatible objects if they enter its range. This will kill them immediately. BlackHole objects use a spherical range whereas BlackHoleCube objects use a box-shaped range. The object's scale settings are used to specify the affection area whereas the size of the model can be changed using Obj_arg0.

field.name: Model Scale
field.notes: Scales the black hole model. Does not change the object's affection area. Default is 1000.

object.name: Bloom Effect Area
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An area that enables bloom shading for compatible objects inside it.
-- CLASS NOTES -- An area that applies bloom effects to compatible objects inside it. For this, the object needs a Bloom.arc model file. However, not all objects support this natively.

field.name: Intensity
field.notes: Strength of the bloom effect. Ranges from 0 to 255. Default is 128.

field.name: Threshold
field.notes: Brightness filter level. Ranges from 0 to 255. Default is 255.

field.name: Intensity 1
field.notes: Primary intensity argument.

field.name: Intensity 2
field.notes: Secondary intensity argument.

object.name: Bloom Effect Area [Cube]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An area that enables bloom shading for compatible objects inside it. The cube's origin is the volume's center.
-- CLASS NOTES -- An area that applies bloom effects to compatible objects inside it. For this, the object needs a Bloom.arc model file. However, not all objects support this natively.

field.name: Intensity
field.notes: Strength of the bloom effect. Ranges from 0 to 255. Default is 128.

field.name: Threshold
field.notes: Brightness filter level. Ranges from 0 to 255. Default is 255.

field.name: Intensity 1
field.notes: Primary intensity argument.

field.name: Intensity 2
field.notes: Secondary intensity argument.

object.name: Bloom Effect Area [Cylinder]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An area that enables bloom shading for compatible objects inside it.

field.name: Intensity
field.notes: Strength of the bloom effect. Ranges from 0 to 255. Default is 128.

field.name: Threshold

field.name: Intensity 1

field.name: Intensity 2
field.notes: Secondary intensity argument.

object.name: "BloomFlower" [Broken]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- Model files have been removed. Therefore, the object is useless.
-- CLASS NOTES -- An unused class that does not work properly due to a programming error. Normally, it is meant to grow if it's in Bulb Yoshi's light range. This would make a Star Bit appear as well. However, the developers messed up a nerve check, so this effect is never triggered. If it's outside Bulb Yoshi's light, however, it will wither again.

-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Pull Star Planet
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A transparent planet with a Pull Star inside; used in Space Junk Galaxy, Ghostly Galaxy and Space Storm Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- Planet-like objects that feature a large Pull Star inside them. The player can use the pointer on the Pull Star to make it attract them. UFOBlueStarCupsule is hardcoded to use a lower target radius.

object.name: Pull Star Explanation Area
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An area that, if entered, notifies the player how to use Pull Stars.
-- CLASS NOTES -- If the player stands inside this area, the game will display an explanation about how to use Pull Stars.

object.name: Pull Star Explanation Area [Cube]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An area that, if entered, notifies the player how to use Pull Stars. The cube's origin is the base's center.
-- CLASS NOTES -- If the player stands inside this area, the game will display an explanation about how to use Pull Stars.

object.name: Bomb
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A bomb that can be picked-up (to light its fuse) and thrown.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A bomb or bomb-like enemy, depending on the object's name. Bomb creates a simple bomb that can be picked up and thrown whereas BombHei creates the actual enemy that will walk around and fuse if it sees the player. It can be stunned and picked up after using a Spin Attack.

field.name: Countdown
field.notes: The time until the bomb explodes. Default 600.

field.name: Explosion Range
field.notes: The explosion's radius. Default 500.0f

object.name: Cluckboom
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A fat bird that drops bombs; used in Dusty Dune Galaxy and Slipsand Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A bird enemy that flies on a path. If the player gets near it, it will drop a bomb that explodes after some seconds. It can be stunned by shooting a Star Bit on it. Can be defeated using most of the player's attacks. Can be frozen by the Orange Luma in SMG2.

field.name: Flies Higher?
field.notes: If enabled, it will fly far above the actual path. Also disables clipping.

object.name: Bob-omb
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A bomb enemy that explodes after a few seconds (once its fuse is lit).
-- CLASS NOTES -- A bomb or bomb-like enemy, depending on the object's name. Bomb creates a simple bomb that can be picked up and thrown whereas BombHei creates the actual enemy that will walk around and fuse if it sees the player. It can be stunned and picked up after using a Spin Attack.

field.name: Countdown
field.notes: The time until the bomb explodes. Default 600.

field.name: Explosion Range
field.notes: The explosion's radius. Default 500.0f

object.name: Bob-omb Dispenser
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An enemy dispenser that releases Bob-ombs.

-- OBJECT NOTES -- A black boo that explodes when it hits something; used in Ghostly Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A Boo variant that can be swung around using its tongue. It can be smashed into several objects to damage or destroy them. If the player swings it around and does not get rid of it after some time, it will blink red and explode.

field.name: Disable Respawning?
field.notes: Disables respawning after it dies.

object.name: Upside Dizzy -- Red Gravity Indicator Wall
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A red wall piece that is used to indicate the direction of gravity in Upside Dizzy Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A generic map object with a model and optional collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame

field.name: Shadow Length

object.name: Boomerang Bro
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A blue Koopa that throws boomerangs.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A Koopa Troopa that throws boomerangs to attack the player. These boomerangs can be destroyed by the player's attacks or eaten by Yoshi to throw them at other objects. Ground Pounding it will defeat it immediately. Other attacks usually stun it first which gives the player an advantage to attack it. Can be frozen by the Orange Luma as well.

field.name: Starting Delay
field.notes: The delay until it starts jumping around.

field.name: Item Type
field.notes: Specifies how items should be spawned.
field.values: -1 = Spawn any items, 0 = Don't spawn any items

field.name: Connect to MapObj?
field.notes: If enabled, it will be attached to the collision below.

object.name: Topmaniac
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The Topman boss fought in Battlerock Galaxy and Dreadnought Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Glamdozer
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The boss used at the end of the first mission of Flipsville Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A dinosaur-like boss that sleeps until the player Ground Pounds the weak spot on her belly. Excluding the first time, the player has to damage her three times. Starting the second phase, she will shoot fire balls that can temporarily cover manhole grates in lava. During the last phase, she will turn red and move faster. She is supposed to be placed on a disk-like planet as she can freely walk around such planets and change sides. She uses two GeneralPos. ボスブッスン位置 is used as her position after the battle. マリオ位置 is used to position the player after the battle. She always spawns a Power Star which needs to be set up in the galaxy's Scenario file.

object.name: Flipsville -- Glamdozer Planet
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The planet used at the end of the first mission of Flipsville Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Giga-Lakitu
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The boss fought at the end of the second mission of Yoshi Star Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A large variant of a Lakitu who wears glasses and rides on a purple cloud. He throws Spinies at the player and may also use thunderbolts to attack them. When he throws Spinies, he will be moving on a path whereas he moves between two separate points when using the thunderbolt attack. He can be damaged by thrown Shells or Yoshi projectiles. After dealing three hits, he will spawn a Power Star. This requires an edit to the galaxy's Scenario file. This object also uses several GeneralPos. ジュゲム突進点１ and ジュゲム突進点２ are used as the right and left points that it moves between when using the thunderbolt attack. カメラ基準点 is used as the orientation point that the camera will look at most of the time. ボスジュゲムデモ位置 defines the position of the intro cutscene. ボスジュゲムダウンデモ位置 defines the position of the defeated cutscene.

field.name: Camera Register Index
field.notes: Specifies the starting index of the vector register cameras.

-- CLASS NOTES -- A set of clouds. If SW_A is triggered, they will turn gray. In this state, they will deal electric damage to the player and compatible enemies. Once the switch is deactivated again, the clouds will disappear.

object.name: Bugaboom
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The boss fought in both the third mission of Honeyhive Galaxy and in the secret mission of Puzzle Plank Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A large bug-like boss that can be damaged by Ground Pounding the weak spot on its back. It needs to be damaged three times. During the first phase, it moves slowly on the ground. After taking the first hit, it starts flying. And in the last phase, its skin turns red and it will make aggressive turns while it flies. While it flies, it will periodically drop explosive bombs that can hurt the player. After it is defeated, it will spawn a Power Star, which also requires changes to the galaxy's Scenario file.

field.name: Camera Register Index
field.notes: Specifies the starting index of the vector and matrix register cameras.

object.name: Small Breakable Glass Cage
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A small breakable glass cage.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A destroyable obstacle that can be destroyed using Koopa Shells, Yoshi's projectiles or any enemy attack except enemy fire damage. Most of its variants can contain an item. Except for Star Bits and Power Stars, the items are only cosmetic. If the item is set to Power Star, the object also requires a proper setup in the galaxy's Scenario file.

field.name: Ignore Gravity?
field.notes: If enabled, the rotation will not be affected by gravity.

field.name: Delay SW_DEAD activation?
field.notes: When enabled, SW_DEAD will be activated immediately instead of having to wait for the breaking animation to finish.

field.name: Play Riddle SFX?
field.notes: If enabled, it will play the "riddle solved" jingle when destroyed.

field.name: Toad/Luma Color
field.notes: The color frame of the Toad or Luma contained inside the cage.

field.name: Item Type
field.notes: The item that is displayed inside the cage. 5 Star Bits and Power Stars can be spawned directly.
field.values: -1 = Nothing, 0 = Coin, 1 = Toad, 2 = Sling Star, 3 = Launch Star, 4 = Star Bits, 5 = Luma, 6 = Key, 7 = Power Star, 8 = 1-Up Mushroom, 9 = Goomba, 10 = Blue Star Chip, 11 = Yellow Star Chip, 12 = Silver Star, 13 = Grand Star, 14 = Life Mushroom

object.name: Gearmo Enemy Checker
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An object used to check if the player brings the correct enemy to the Gearmo in Boulder Bowl Galaxy and Space Storm Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- This registers and controls the enemies requested by a CareTakerHunter. This object is usually linked to a CareTakerHunter using GeneratorId. Otherwise, it's useless on its own. The requested enemies can be attached to this object by setting their GeneratorId to this object's l_id. Supported enemies are Kuribo, TogeBegomanLauncher, BegomanLauncher and BegomanBabyLauncher. If a requested enemy is in this object's sensor range, it will notify the linked CareTakerHunter.

object.name: Damaging Cactus
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A cactus that can damage the player or other objects upon contact.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A simple object that damages the player and compatible objects, such as SandBirdParts objects.

object.name: Camera Area
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An area that causes the camera to change when the player enters it.
-- CLASS NOTES -- An area that changes the current camera once the player enters this area. The actual camera parameters are specified in the zone's CameraParam.bcam. The corresponding camera ID label is generated using the printf format string c:%04x. For example, if your camera area has an Obj_arg0 of 15, the corresponding ID label would be c:000f. This can also be restricted to take effect only under different circumstances (Obj_arg3).

field.name: Camera ID
field.notes: Specifies what camera setup to use after entering this area.

field.name: Priority
field.notes: The camera area with the highest priority and requested categories will take effect.

field.name: Affected Contexts
field.notes: Bitfield of contexts that are affected by camera changes through this area. In SMG2, these values can be combined by adding the values together. If set to 0, the game will set this value to 1. In SMG1, this setting is much more complicated: The lower four bits can be used to specify a single category (0 = Normal, 1 = Underwater, ...). These bits will be ignored if bit 4 or higher is set. These upper bits then correspond to be bitmask values (16 = Normal, 32 = Underwater, ...).
field.values: -1 = All, 1 = Normal camera, 2 = Underwater camera, 4 = Water surface camera, 8 = Pull Star camera, 16 = Flying camera, 32 = Yoshi camera (SMG2 only), 64 = Bulb Yoshi camera (SMG2 only)

Said variant may also appear without a flame if it uses a SW_A. Instead, the player can use Fire Balls to lit the fire and activate the switch.

field.name: Attach to Collision?

Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

field.name: Texture Frame

-- CLASS NOTES -- A locked cage that can be opened by activating its SW_B switch.

field.name: Riddle SFX Type
field.notes: Specifies what sound effect to play after the cage gets opened.
field.values: -1 = No special sound effect, 1 = Play RiddleSE

field.name: Play Star Chance Music?
field.notes: If set, it will play the STM_STAR_CHANCE_3 music once it gets opened.

field.name: Use Alternate Model?
field.notes: Tries to load the model CapsuleCageNoKeyHole if enabled. This model does not exist anymore, though.

object.name: Collapsing Engine Parts Generator

-- CLASS NOTES -- Periodically spawns collapsing debris that can damage the player upon contact. The individual debris can be frozen by the Orange Luma. For each spawn, a random debris model gets loaded. These models are called CaveInPartsBig, CaveInPartsMiddle and CaveInPartsSmall.

field.name: Delay
field.notes: Time between spawns in frames.

field.name: Debris Count
field.notes: The number of debris to be generated. Stops generation after the requested amount has appeared. If set to -1, it will keep spawning more debris.

object.name: Limited Flying Range Area
object.notes:

-- CLASS NOTES -- If the player attempts to exit this area while using the Flying power-up, they will be restricted to move inside the area only. The flying effect will be cancelled when the player reaches the edge of this area.

object.name: Coin
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A collectable yellow Coin.
-- CLASS NOTES -- One of the game's main collectibles. There are two variants: Coins (Coin) and Purple Coins (PurpleCoin). Normal Coins can restore one health point if collected by the player. Purple Coins do not restore health, though. Purple Coins can only be used in Purple Comet scenarios or appropriately configured Scenario files. Normal Coins won't appear during Daredevil (Dark) Comets. Both variants can be collected by the Orange Luma in SMG2. If they are stored inside a bubble, they will also restore the player's air when underwater. Coins will spin slower when placed underwater.

field.name: Shadow Calculation
field.notes: If set, the shadow will be calculated at all times and the game takes the shadow range into account when clipping.

field.name: Pose Type
field.notes: Defines how to to position and rotate the Coin. May also connect the Coin to the collision below in SMG2.
field.values: -1 = Rotation & shadow direction affected by gravity, 0 = Rotation ignores gravity & shadow direction affected by gravity, 1 = Attach to Collision below & shadow direction not affected by gravity (SMG2 only)

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: Sets the shadow drop length.

field.name: Shadow Type
field.notes: Specifies the shadow model type.
field.values: -1 = Sphere, 0 = SurfaceCircle, 1 = Cylinder

field.name: Inside Bubble?
field.notes: If true, the Coin will be placed inside an Air Bubble.

object.name: Coin Spawn Point
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An object that spawns several Coins when activated.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A point in space where the requested number of Coins will be spawned after activating its SW_APPEAR switch.

field.name: Number of Coins
field.notes: The number of Coins to be spawned. Default is 8.

object.name: Coin ? Block [2D]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A ? Block used in SMG2's intro level. It drops exactly one Coin when hit.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Invisible Coin Spot
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An invisible spot that will spawn a Coin when using a Spin Attack nearby.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Coin Flower
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A decorative flower that spawns one Coin when hit by a Star Bit.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Spin-Dig -- Pear Planet Interior
object.notes:

-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Spin-Dig -- Pear Planet Exterior

-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Coin 1-Up Bonus Controller
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- Rewards the player a 1-Up when all grouped Coins have been collected.
-- CLASS NOTES -- Creates a set of Coins that will appear once this object's SW_APPEAR gets triggered. These Coins will only be collectable for the specified period of time or indefinitely (Obj_arg0). If the player collects all linked Coins in time, they will be rewarded with a 1-Up. The actual Coin objects need to be linked to this object by setting their GeneratorId's to this object's l_id. Compatible Coin objects are CircleCoinGroup and RailCoin.

field.name: Timer
field.notes: Specifies the timer during which the Coins will be visible. Coins will appear indefinitely if set to -1. Default is -1.

object.name: Deactivated Coin
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A Coin that can only be collected if a specific switch is activated.
-- CLASS NOTES --

field.name: Texture Frame

field.name: Shadow Length

object.notes:

object.notes:

-- CLASS NOTES -- An area that, when entered, forces the player to use the Invincibility power-up. The player won't be able to get rid of it until they leave the area again.

object.name: Library Cutscene Object Holder
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A holder that creates and registers several objects for the last cutscene in the Library Room.
-- CLASS NOTES -- Creates and registers several objects that appear during the ending cutscene in the Comet Observatory's library. The cutscene that it tries to register to has to be called コンプリートエンディング. The individual objects with their model name and object name are RosettaReading (デモ用ロゼッタ), RosettaChair (デモ用ロゼッタ椅子), TicoBaby (デモ用ベビチコ) and MarioCap or LuigiCap (デモ用マリオ帽子). It has a special nerve action for cutscenes which makes all objects appear when triggered. The GeneralPos コンプリートエンディングデモ基準点 marks the reference point for the objects.

field.name: Play "Move" Animation
field.notes: Plays an animation called Move if enabled. No actual object of this class has such animations, so it's never used.

field.name: Useless
field.notes: The game reads this value but never uses it. This is only read if Obj_arg0 is set.

field.name: Item Type
field.notes: Specifies what kind of item to spawn after destroying it.
field.values: -1 = Star Bits, 0 = Nothing, 1 = Coin

field.name: Number of Star Bits
field.notes: The number of Star Bits to spawn after destroying it. Obj_arg2 has to be set to -1. Default is 5.

field.name: Hide Broken Pieces?
field.notes: If set, the remaining broken pieces will be hidden.

object.name: Camera Area [Bowl]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An area that causes the camera to change when the player enters it.
-- CLASS NOTES -- An area that changes the current camera once the player enters this area. The actual camera parameters are specified in the zone's CameraParam.bcam. The corresponding camera ID label is generated using the printf format string c:%04x. For example, if your camera area has an Obj_arg0 of 15, the corresponding ID label would be c:000f. This can also be restricted to take effect only under different circumstances (Obj_arg3).

field.name: Camera ID
field.notes: Specifies what camera setup to use after entering this area.

field.name: Priority
field.notes: The camera area with the highest priority and requested categories will take effect.

field.name: Affected Contexts
field.notes: Bitfield of contexts that are affected by camera changes through this area. In SMG2, these values can be combined by adding the values together. If set to 0, the game will set this value to 1. In SMG1, this setting is much more complicated: The lower four bits can be used to specify a single category (0 = Normal, 1 = Underwater, ...). These bits will be ignored if bit 4 or higher is set. These upper bits then correspond to be bitmask values (16 = Normal, 32 = Underwater, ...).
field.values: -1 = All, 1 = Normal camera, 2 = Underwater camera, 4 = Water surface camera, 8 = Pull Star camera, 16 = Flying camera, 32 = Yoshi camera (SMG2 only), 64 = Bulb Yoshi camera (SMG2 only)

object.notes:

These bits will be ignored if bit 4 or higher is set. These upper bits then correspond to be bitmask values (16 = Normal, 32 = Underwater, ...).
field.values: -1 = All, 1 = Normal camera, 2 = Underwater camera, 4 = Water surface camera, 8 = Pull Star camera, 16 = Flying camera, 32 = Yoshi camera (SMG2 only), 64 = Bulb Yoshi camera (SMG2 only)

field.notes: Active distance from player's position.

field.name: Hide during Intro?
field.notes: The air won't appear during the intro if enabled.

field.name: Always Active?
field.notes: Always active if enabled.

object.name: Metal Debris

-- OBJECT NOTES -- A set of metal particles used as space debris.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btk) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

object.name: Warp Pipe
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The iconic pipe used to warp the player from one place to another.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A Warp Pipe that can transport the player to another Warp Pipe instance. However, it also supports various other modes and functions unrelated to transportation. Warp Pipes that are placed in WhiteSnowGalaxy have a hardcoded clipping range of 1000.

field.name: Exit Force (Forwards)
field.notes: The force to push the player forwards when exiting the pipe. Default 5.

field.name: Exit Force (Upwards)
field.notes: The force to push the player upwards when exiting the pipe. Default 25.

field.name: Mode
field.notes: The pipe's behavior after being entered.
field.values: -1 = Entrance and exit, 1 = Exit only, 2 = Hidden until first exited, 3 = Eject without warping, 4 = Eject without warping (spawns Coins), 5 = Eject without warping (spawns Star Bits), 6 = Hide when exited

field.name: Connection ID
field.notes: Set two pipes to have the same number to link them together.

field.name: Music Change
field.notes: Index of the music to change to once the pipe is left.

field.name: Music State
field.notes: The state of the music that plays after exiting the pipe.

field.name: Ignore Gravity?
field.notes: If enabled, the rotation of the pipe will not be affected by gravity.

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: The animation frame to use as the pipe's color.
field.values: -1 = Green, 1 = Orange

object.name: Underwater Warp Pipe
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A Warp Pipe with a vortex that sucks in the player if they are nearby.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A Warp Pipe that can transport the player to another Warp Pipe instance. However, it also supports various other modes and functions unrelated to transportation. Warp Pipes that are placed in WhiteSnowGalaxy have a hardcoded clipping range of 1000.

field.name: Exit Force (Forwards)
field.notes: The force to push the player forwards when exiting the pipe. Default 5.

field.name: Exit Force (Upwards)
field.notes: The force to push the player upwards when exiting the pipe. Default 25.

field.name: Mode
field.notes: The pipe's behavior after being entered.
field.values: -1 = Entrance and exit, 1 = Exit only, 2 = Hidden until first exited, 3 = Eject without warping, 4 = Eject without warping (spawns Coins), 5 = Eject without warping (spawns Star Bits), 6 = Hide when exited

field.name: Connection ID
field.notes: Set two pipes to have the same number to link them together.

field.name: Music Change
field.notes: Index of the music to change to once the pipe is left.

field.name: Music State
field.notes: The state of the music that plays after exiting the pipe.

field.name: Ignore Gravity?
field.notes: If enabled, the rotation of the pipe will not be affected by gravity.

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: The animation frame to use as the pipe's color.
field.values: -1 = Green, 1 = Orange

object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A wooden bridge used in the second mission of Honeyhive Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A generic map object with a model and optional collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

object.name: Shiverburn -- Flaming Volcano
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The flaming volcano used in Shiverburn Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A variant of SimpleMapObj. This is a generic map object with a model, collision and looping particle effect. The UniqueName effect types that can be specified are EffectEmitStart and EffectEmitStart. If the object is called PeachCastleMeteor, it will ignore clipping checks. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

-- CLASS NOTES -- An object that will rotate along it's axis.
It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

field.name: Riddle SFX Type
field.notes: Specifies what sound effect to play after the cage gets opened.
field.values: -1 = No special sound effect, 1 = Play RiddleSE

field.name: Play Star Chance Music?
field.notes: If set, it will play the STM_STAR_CHANCE_3 music once it gets opened.

field.name: Use Alternate Model?
field.notes: Tries to load the model CapsuleCageNoKeyHole if enabled. This model does not exist anymore, though.

field.name: Texture Frame

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

field.name: Range
field.notes: Active distance from player's position.

field.name: Hide during Intro?
field.notes: The air won't appear during the intro if enabled.

field.name: Always Active?
field.notes: Always active if enabled.

object.name: Bullet Bill Spawner
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A bullet-like enemy that may home onto the player if they get in its range.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A point that launches bullet-like enemies. "HomingKiller" generates Bullet Bills, "Torpedo" generates Torpedo Teds and "MagnumKiller" generates Banzai Bills. The enemies will be generated periodically.

field.name: Homing Activation Range
field.notes: The range the player has to be in for the bullet to start homing in. Default 2000.

field.name: Turn Speed Multiplier
field.notes: A multiplier for the bullet's turn speed. Useful in places with tight corners. Default 1.

field.name: Disable Homing)
field.notes: If enabled, the bullets won't home in on Mario.

field.name: Ignore Gravity?
field.notes: If enabled, Gravity will be ignored.

field.name: Bullet Count
field.notes: The amount of bullets that can exist at once. Default 1.

field.name: Launch Delay
field.notes: The delay between shots. Default 180.

field.name: Bullet Lifetime
field.notes: The lifespan that bullets will live for before being automatically killed. Default 600.

field.name: Binder Activation delay
field.notes: A delay until this bullet can collide with terrain. Default 35.

object.name: Triple Propeller Airship
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A standard airship with three propellers on top.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A generic map object with a model and optional collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

object.name: Banzai Bill Spawner
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- Generates larger versions of Bullet Bills.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A point that launches bullet-like enemies. "HomingKiller" generates Bullet Bills, "Torpedo" generates Torpedo Teds and "MagnumKiller" generates Banzai Bills. The enemies will be generated periodically.

field.name: Homing Activation Range
field.notes: The range the player has to be in for the bullet to start homing in. Default 2000.

field.name: Turn Speed Multiplier
field.notes: A multiplier for the bullet's turn speed. Useful in places with tight corners. Default 1.

field.name: Disable Homing)
field.notes: If enabled, the bullets won't home in on Mario.

field.name: Ignore Gravity?
field.notes: If enabled, Gravity will be ignored.

field.name: Bullet Count
field.notes: The amount of bullets that can exist at once. Default 1.

field.name: Launch Delay
field.notes: The delay between shots. Default 180.

field.name: Bullet Lifetime
field.notes: The lifespan that bullets will live for before being automatically killed. Default 600.

field.name: Binder Activation delay
field.notes: A delay until this bullet can collide with terrain. Default 35.

field.name: Entrance Type
field.notes: Defines how the player enters the scene.
field.values: -1 = Spinning, 1 = Standing, 2 = Walking In

field.name: Appearance
field.notes: Initial nerve state.
field.values: -1 = Wait, 0 = Runaway, 1 = Float

field.name: Respawn
field.notes: Keeps respawning after killing if enabled.

object.name: Mercator Projection Area [Cube]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A special area that projects compatible objects inside of it around the origin of the zone. The cube's origin is the base's center.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: "MercatorFixParts" [Unused]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A stationary object that uses mercator projection for placement. It retrieves a proper model using ShapeModelNo, however, no more models exist for this object.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: "MercatorRailMoveParts" [Unused]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A path-moving object that uses mercator projection for placement. It retrieves a proper model using ShapeModelNo, however, no more models exist for this object.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Toy Time -- Factory Cage
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A blue cage used on the factory planet.
-- CLASS NOTES -- An object that will rotate along it's axis.
It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

object.name: Toy Time -- Factory Fan
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An animated fan used on the factory planet.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A generic map object with a model and optional collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

object.name: Decorative Bee Mushroom
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A Bee Mushroom used in the power-up display room of Starship Mario.
-- CLASS NOTES -- Displays a model of a power-up that cannot be collected. These objects only serve a decorative purpose. Natively, only the Spring, Bee, Boo, Fire, Cloud, Rock and Drill power-ups are supported. Can be registered to Starship Mario events via MarioFaceShipNpcRegister.

object.name: Bee Mushroom
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A Bee Mushroom that transforms the player into a Bee character.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A collectable item that turns the player into a Bee character. This power-up state allows them to fly around like a bee.

field.name: Appearance Type
field.notes: Specifies how the item appears after SW_APPEAR gets activated.
field.values: -1 = Appears in place, 1 = Appears above and falls down

field.name: Binder Type
field.notes: Enables or disables collision binding.
field.values: -1 = Deactivated, 1 = Activated

field.name: Landing Type
field.notes: Specifies whether the power-up falls down after appearing or not.
field.values: -1 = Lands when it appears, 1 = Stays in position where it appeared

field.name: Inside Bubble?
field.notes: Specifies if the item is stored in a bubble or not.
field.values: -1 = Not contained in a bubble, 1 = Contained in a bubble

field.name: Shadow & Clipping Type
field.notes: Specifies the shadow and clipping properties.
field.values: -1 = Calculate shadow drop direction from gravity once, 0 = Nothing, 1 = Calculate shadow, 2 = Calculate shadow drop and direction from gravity once, 3 = Use spherical clipping and calculate shadow drop direction from gravity once, 4 = Use spherical clipping and calculate shadow drop direction from gravity once

field.name: Appearance Camera Type
field.notes: Specifies what appearance event cameras are to be used.
field.values: -1 = No cameras, 1 = Use 出現1, 2 = Use 出現1 and 出現2

field.name: Rotation Type
field.notes: Specifies how the item rotates.
field.values: -1 = Rotate + unknown, 0 = Don't rotate, 1 = Rotate, 2 = Don't rotate + unknown

object.name: Power-Up Switch Area
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- Activates a switch if the player enters it while using a specific power-up.
-- CLASS NOTES -- If the player stays inside this area and fulfills the specified conditions (Obj_arg0), it will activate its SW_A switch. If the player leaves the area again or the condition is not met anymore, the switch will be deactivated again. If Obj_arg0 is set to 1, it will check if the player is "in rush". This refers to the state where the player is bound to another object, for example Fluzzard, Rock Mushroom's rolling rock, the Star Ball and more.

field.name: Condition
field.notes: The required power-up state condition to activate the switch.
field.values: -1 = Player using Boo power-up, 1 = Player is "in rush", 2 = Player riding Bulb Yoshi

object.name: Smoking Meteor
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A decorative meteor that creates smoke effects; used in the prologue at Peach's Castle.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A variant of SimpleMapObj. This is a generic map object with a model, collision and looping particle effect. The UniqueName effect types that can be specified are EffectEmitStart and EffectEmitStart. If the object is called PeachCastleMeteor, it will ignore clipping checks. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

object.name: Blue Flame Torch
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A small torch.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A torch with a flame that can burn the player upon contact. Usually, the flame can be put out using a Spin Attack to make an item appear, however, the flame of CandlestandIceVolcano cannot be put out. Said variant may also appear without a flame if it uses a SW_A. Instead, the player can use Fire Balls to lit the fire and activate the switch.

field.name: Item Type
field.notes: Specifies the item to be spawned after putting out the fire.
field.values: -1 = Coin, 0 = Star Bit, 1 = Nothing

field.name: Attach to Collision?
field.notes: If set, it will be connected to the collision below. This makes it move along moving objects, for example.

object.name: Deep Dark -- Red Metal Platform
object.notes:

-- CLASS NOTES -- A generic map object with a model and optional collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

object.name: Redirect Player Movement Area [Cube]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An area that changes the direction the player is moving to by 90 degrees as soon as entered. The cube's origin is the base's center.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Circular 2D Movement Area [Cube]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An area that restricts movement to a 2D plane when entered. The movement direction is adjusted for moving around a circular center point. The cube's origin is the base's center.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Extended Item Sensor Area
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An area which extends the sensor range when trying to collect items along the camera's view direction. For example, this allows the player to collect an item while they stand behind or in front of it.
-- CLASS NOTES -- An area that extends the player's sensor range to detect items. This allows the player to collect an item while they stand closely behind or in front of it. This depends on the camera's view direction.

object.name: Extended Item Sensor Area [Cube]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An area which extends the sensor range when trying to collect items along the camera's view direction. For example, this allows the player to collect an item while thy stand behind or in front of it. The cube's origin is the base's center.
-- CLASS NOTES -- An area that extends the player's sensor range to detect items. This allows the player to collect an item while they stand closely behind or in front of it. This depends on the camera's view direction.

-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: 2D Movement Area [Cube]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An area that restricts movement to a 2D plane when entered. The cube's origin is the base's center.

object.name: Disable Movement Direction Retention Area
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- This area adjusts the player's movement direction to the current camera angle instead of keeping the direction the joystick was held in before moving.
-- CLASS NOTES -- An area that adjusts the player's movement direction all the time. Usually, when a camera change occurs, the player will keep walking into the direction the stick was held before the camera changed. This prevents exactly that.

object.name: Purple Coin
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A Purple Coin from Purple Comet missions that spawns a Power Star once 100 of them are collected.
-- CLASS NOTES -- One of the game's main collectibles. There are two variants: Coins (Coin) and Purple Coins (PurpleCoin). Normal Coins can restore one health point if collected by the player. Purple Coins do not restore health, though. Purple Coins can only be used in Purple Comet scenarios or appropriately configured Scenario files. Normal Coins won't appear during Daredevil (Dark) Comets. Both variants can be collected by the Orange Luma in SMG2. If they are stored inside a bubble, they will also restore the player's air when underwater. Coins will spin slower when placed underwater.

field.name: Shadow Calculation
field.notes: If set, the shadow will be calculated at all times and the game takes the shadow range into account when clipping.

field.name: Pose Type
field.notes: Defines how to to position and rotate the Coin. May also connect the Coin to the collision below in SMG2.
field.values: -1 = Rotation & shadow direction affected by gravity, 0 = Rotation ignores gravity & shadow direction affected by gravity, 1 = Attach to Collision below & shadow direction not affected by gravity (SMG2 only)

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: Sets the shadow drop length.

field.name: Shadow Type
field.notes: Specifies the shadow model type.
field.values: -1 = Sphere, 0 = SurfaceCircle, 1 = Cylinder

field.name: Inside Bubble?
field.notes: If true, the Coin will be placed inside an Air Bubble.

object.name: Toy Time -- Large Screw Planet Gear
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A rotating wood gear used on the large screw planet.
-- CLASS NOTES -- An object that will rotate along it's axis.
It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

object.name: Toy Time -- Large Screw
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The large screw used during the second mission.
-- CLASS NOTES -- An object class that uses paths to move and rotate.
It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

object.name: Enable Ice Collision Rescue Position Area
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An area that enables saving the last position on Ice or GlassIce collision as a safe rescuing position.
-- CLASS NOTES -- Normally, when the player falls into a PullBackArea, they won't be returned to the last position on Ice or GlassIce collision. Instead, the game treats several other collision types as safe rescuing positions. However, this area ignores the check for these two collision types so that these collision triangles are treated as proper rescuing positions.

object.name: Sling Pod
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A weird spiderweb-like object which Mario and certain NPCs (Toads) can attach to and then be launched in a straight line by pulling it with the star pointer holding A in the opposite direction of the desired launch and then releasing A. How far back you pull it also affects the speed and distance of the launch. There is no way to detach yourself or an NPC to it other than launching.
Extra Notes: If you are setting up a Tarantox battle, do not use this object, but it's special variant for Tarantox called SpiderAttachPoint.
-- CLASS NOTES --

This unused Ice Flower ability is extremely buggy and unpredictable, do not try to use it in your galaxies.

-- OBJECT NOTES -- Another small stone platform from Space Junk Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A generic map object with a model and optional collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

object.name: Rock Mushroom Star Bit Crystal

object.name: Moving Star Bit Group

-- OBJECT NOTES -- Creates a group of Star Bits that move on a set path.
-- CLASS NOTES --

field.name: Number of Star Bits
field.notes: Amount of Star Bits to be distrbuted along the path or circle.

field.name: Circle radius
field.notes: Radius of the Star Bit circle, only used if a path has not been assigned.

field.name: Star Bit Color
field.notes: The color the Star Bits will be.
field.values: -1 = Random, 0 = Purple, 1 = Yellow, 2 = Green, 3 = Blue, 4 = Red, 5 = White

object.name: Launch Star
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A large star-shaped ring that launches the player from one point to another.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A large star-shaped ring that launches the player from one point to another.

field.name: Flight Time
field.notes: The amount of time the flight takes to complete (in frames). Default 300.

field.name: Shadow Drop Distance
field.notes: The distance to drop the shadow. Default -1.

field.name: Don't Grab Mario
field.notes: If set, the Launch Star won't pull the player towards it when they get near.

field.name: Camera Count
field.notes: The number of Cameras to be read from the camera file.

field.name: No Appear Jingle
field.notes: If enabled, the usual Launch Star appear jingle will not play.

field.name: Landing Rotation
field.notes: The rotation that the player lands at. (NOTE: Needs further research as the rotation angle seems inconsistent)

field.name: Unknown 6
field.notes: Only used in Beach Bowl (SMG1)

field.name: SpinDriverPathStorage Index
field.notes: The index of this launch star's path in the internal SpinDriverPathStorage class. This Arg is read by both games but only functions in SMG1.

object.name: Switch Area
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An area that activates a switch once the player enters it.
-- CLASS NOTES -- An area that activates a switch once the player enters it.

field.name: Deactivate when area is left?
field.notes: If enabled, SW_A will be disabled after leaving the area.

field.name: Invert Output
field.notes: If set, turns off SW_A instead of turning it on.

field.name: Ground Use Only?
field.notes: If set, Mario must be on the ground inside the area to activate SW_A.

field.name: Riddle SFX
field.notes: Plays Riddle SFX when activated.
field.values: -1 = = No Sound, 0 = = SE_SY_READ_RIDDLE_S, 1 = = SE_SY_READ_RIDDLE_SS

field.name: Spin Drill Use Only?
field.notes: If set, requires the player be using a Spin Drill. (This arg is unused in the vanilla game)

object.name: Red "?" Block
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An unusual looking red and pink "?" block.
Behaves like a regular "?" block but does not drop anything, instead it fires the events linked to it's SW_DEAD
-- CLASS NOTES --
