object.name: Switch Area [Sphere]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An area that activates a switch once the player enters it.
-- CLASS NOTES -- An area that activates a switch once the player enters it.

field.name: Deactivate when area is left?
field.notes: If enabled, SW_A will be disabled after leaving the area.

field.name: Invert Output
field.notes: If set, turns off SW_A instead of turning it on.

field.name: Ground Use Only?
field.notes: If set, Mario must be on the ground inside the area to activate SW_A.

field.name: Riddle SFX
field.notes: Plays Riddle SFX when activated.
field.values: -1 = = No Sound, 0 = = SE_SY_READ_RIDDLE_S, 1 = = SE_SY_READ_RIDDLE_SS

field.name: Spin Drill Use Only?
field.notes: If set, requires the player be using a Spin Drill. (This arg is unused in the vanilla game)

object.name: Reverse Switch Controller
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- Keeps a switch activated while another switch is not activated. Effectively, this implements NOT gate logic.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Guppy
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A shark who races the player through several underwater rings and awards them a Power Star if beaten. Seen in Sea Slide Galaxy and Deep Dark Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Octopus Barrel
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A barrel that is used to protect an Octopus.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Small Octopus Barrel
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An unused smaller version of TakoBarrelA.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A generic map object with a model and optional collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

object.name: Ghostly Candlestick
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A lit candlestick used in Ghostly Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A torch with a flame that can burn the player upon contact. Usually, the flame can be put out using a Spin Attack to make an item appear, however, the flame of CandlestandIceVolcano cannot be put out. Said variant may also appear without a flame if it uses a SW_A. Instead, the player can use Fire Balls to lit the fire and activate the switch.

field.name: Item Type
field.notes: Specifies the item to be spawned after putting out the fire.
field.values: -1 = Coin, 0 = Star Bit, 1 = Nothing

field.name: Attach to Collision?
field.notes: If set, it will be connected to the collision below. This makes it move along moving objects, for example.

-- CLASS NOTES -- A variant of SimpleMapObj that starts the TexChange.btk animation and freezes its frame at 1 once its SW_A gets activated. Like SimpleMapObj, this is a generic map object with a model and collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

object.name: Timer Switch
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A switch that appears another switch after the requested number of frames elapsed.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Spiky Topman Spawner
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A black hole that spawns Spiky Topman. Defeated Spiky Topman will respawn after some time.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A black hole that periodically spawns more Topman enemies. It will only generate one enemy at a time but it will ensure that the provided number of enemies will be spawned. Defeated enemies will respawn after a while. BegomanLauncher generates Spring Topmen, BegomanBabyLauncher generates Topmini and TogeBegomanLauncher generates Spike Topmen.

field.name: Activation Delay
field.notes: The delay until the first spawn occurs.

field.name: Number of Topman
field.notes: Defines the number of Topman to be spawned. Default is 1.

object.name: Pinhead
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A bowling pin that can be defeated using the Rock power-up.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Bowling Challenge Foul Area
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An area that, when entered, results in a foul during The Chimp's bowling challenge.
-- CLASS NOTES -- If the player enters this area, any TogepinScorer will detect this as a foul. If this happens, the player needs to get out of the area to make the minigame resume. This area has no effect if the player is rolling around using the Rock power-up.

object.name: The Chimp [Bowling Challenge]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The Chimp used for the bowling challenge in Melty Monster Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Bowling Challenge Controller
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A controller that sets up bowling challenges and controls the scoring.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Spiny
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A red-shelled enemy with spikes on its back.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Tarantox
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- The giant spider-like boss fought at the end of Space Junk Galaxy's third mission.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Spiny Hermit
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A white-shelled enemy with spikes on its back.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Spiny Hermit [2D]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A variant of a Spiny Hermit for 2D sections.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Torpedo Ted Spawner
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A spawner for torpedo-like enemies that may home onto the player if they get in its range.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A point that launches bullet-like enemies. "HomingKiller" generates Bullet Bills, "Torpedo" generates Torpedo Teds and "MagnumKiller" generates Banzai Bills. The enemies will be generated periodically.

field.name: Homing Activation Range
field.notes: The range the player has to be in for the bullet to start homing in. Default 2000.

field.name: Turn Speed Multiplier
field.notes: A multiplier for the bullet's turn speed. Useful in places with tight corners. Default 1.

field.name: Disable Homing)
field.notes: If enabled, the bullets won't home in on Mario.

field.name: Ignore Gravity?
field.notes: If enabled, Gravity will be ignored.

field.name: Bullet Count
field.notes: The amount of bullets that can exist at once. Default 1.

field.name: Launch Delay
field.notes: The delay between shots. Default 180.

field.name: Bullet Lifetime
field.notes: The lifespan that bullets will live for before being automatically killed. Default 600.

field.name: Binder Activation delay
field.notes: A delay until this bullet can collide with terrain. Default 35.

object.name: Cylindrical 2D Movement Area [Cylinder]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- An area that enforces 2D movement around a cylinder. Meant to be used for cylindrical-shaped planets. This area is always cylindrical
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Toy Time -- Decorative Wood Gear
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A decorative rotating wood gear.
-- CLASS NOTES -- An object that will rotate along it's axis.
It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

object.name: Pink Bouncy Ball Planet
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A small checkered red and pink planet which the player bounces on when stepped. It's primary apparition is in Ghostly Galaxy.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Starship Mario Transformation Cutscene Object Holder
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A holder that creates and registers some of the objects used for the cutscene where the Starship Mario is created.
-- CLASS NOTES --

object.name: Tiny Gilded Metal Sphere
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A tiny dark sphere of gilded metal used as a generic base for other objects such as Air Bubble generators, Bullet Bill launchers, flamethrowers, etc.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A generic map object with a model and optional collision. It also supports BCK, BTK, BTP, BRK and BVA animations. Animations must have the same name as the model in order to be played. The animations will start playing once the object loads. Also supports color change (ColorChange.brk) and texture change (TexChange.btk/.btp) animations as well as shadows (Shadow.bcsv).

field.name: Color Frame
field.notes: If ColorChange.brk exists, this will define the color frame to be used.

field.name: Texture Frame
field.notes: If TexChange.btp/.btk exists, this will define the texture frame to be used.

field.name: Shadow Length
field.notes: If Shadow.bcsv exists, this defines the shadow's drop length.

-- CLASS NOTES -- When entered by the player, all compatible objects in its ViewGroup will be forced to render.

field.name: View Group ID
field.notes: The ViewGroup of objects that should be rendered.

field.name: LOD Mode
field.notes: Overrides the LOD system by forcing the objects to use this specified LOD mode instead.
field.values: -1 = Don't override LOD system, 1 = Display High model, 2 = Display Middle model, 3 = Display Low model, 4 = Prevent rendering

field.name: Coin Count
field.notes: The number of coins to spawn when broken. Default 1.

field.name: Hide Broken Pieces
field.notes: If enabled, the leftover broken pieces will be hidden.

field.name: Starbit Count
field.notes: The number of coins to spawn when broken. Default 0.

field.name: Play 'Secret Found' Sound
field.notes: If enabled, will play a jingle when broken.

field.name: Spawn 1-UP
field.notes: If enabled, spawns a 1-UP mushroom when broken.

field.name: Power Star ID

object.name: Star Chip
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- A collectable yellow chip. Usually, five of them have to be collected.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A collectable yellow chip. Usually five of these are linked together by a YellowChipGroup to trigger a switch to spawn something like a Launch Star.

field.name: Star Chip Group ID
field.notes: The ID of the YellowChipGroup this Star Chip is linked to.

field.name: Inside Bubble
field.notes: If checked, the chip will spawn inside an air bubble.

field.name: Shadow Drop Length
field.notes: The distance downwards that the object's shadow is projected.

field.name: Shadow Shape
field.notes: The shape of the object's shadow.
field.values: -1 = = Sphere, 0 = = Cylinder

object.name: Star Chip Group
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- Controls a collection of Star Chips and activates something once all are collected.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A controller which activates SW_A when all Star Chip (YellowChip) objects linked to it by the obj_arg0 value are collected. It is recommended to have groups of 5 Star Chips.
This controller is also responsible for displaying the Star Chip Counter layout at the top of the screen.

field.name: Group ID
field.notes: The ID of this group for Star Chips to link to.

field.name: Star Chip Counter Display Range
field.notes: The distance the player has to be within of this object for the Star Chip Counter to be displayed.
field.values: -1 = = Always display

field.name: Re-activate When Previously Activated
field.notes: If checked, re-activates SW_A upon a soft reload (ex: after a death) if already activated before.

object.name: "YoshiBlock" [Broken]
object.notes:
-- OBJECT NOTES -- Model files have been removed. Therefore, the object is useless.
-- CLASS NOTES -- A somewhat glitchy object that requires a custom file to be used. It loads the texture from YoshiBlock.arc/YoshiBlock/YoshiBlockTex.bti and it is a simple block that has no specific use. For some reason, it can't be seen in first-person view or during intro camera cutscenes.
